definition: to defect/to desert/to betray and flee

sentences.english: The successful defection of Lyalin presented MI5 with a unique opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 利亞林叛逃成功使軍情5局得到了一個難得的機會。

sentences.english: The scientist defected to another country.
sentences.chinese: 那名科學家叛逃到另一國家了。

sentences.english: The wrangling over the defectors is the latest friction between the Koreas.
sentences.chinese: 關於叛逃者們的爭吵是朝韓兩國最近一次的摩擦。

sentences.english: The former politician defected to South Korea in 1997
sentences.chinese: 前政治家黃長燁於1997年叛逃到韓國。

sentences.english: Under the high pressure, kindergarten teachers have the psychology of betraying the occupation.
sentences.chinese: 高壓力之下，幼兒教師對本職業有心理叛逃的現象。

sentences.english: He defected from a certain country to the West.
sentences.chinese: 他從某國叛逃到了西方。

sentences.english: He was executed as a deserter.
The political defector was refuged in an embassy.
sentences.chinese: 那個政治叛逃者被一大使館接納避難。

sentences.english: It was he who first fingered Philby in the USA after defection of Burgess and Maclean.
sentences.chinese: 麥克萊恩叛逃之後，首先在美國指出了菲爾比。

sentences.english: In the summer of 1974, Mikhail Baryshnikov defected in Toronto.
sentences.chinese: 年夏天，巴里什尼科夫在多倫多叛逃。

sentences.english: The Repledge window will now close if you move away from the Runemaster.
sentences.chinese: 當你遠離叛逃師以後，叛逃窗口將會關閉。

sentences.english: The Repledge window will now close if you move away from the Runemaster.
sentences.chinese: 當你遠離叛逃師以後，叛逃窗口將會關閉。

sentences.english: Others said their family members have no reason to defect to South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 其他人則說他們的家人沒有理由叛逃韓國。

sentences.english: Two years later, burgess and maclean defected .
sentences.chinese: 兩年以後，伯吉斯和麥克萊恩叛逃了。

definition: to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
to betray/to desert/to defect from/to turn renegade
to go over to the enemy/to defect
to rely on help from sb
